title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Soleillades Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: In its classic Provence skittle bottle, this is a wine for quaffing at a patio or restaurant table. Pale in color but packed with red fruit, it is an immediately attractive fruity and lively wine. Drink now.

title: Tenuta dei Mille 2015 Anita Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: This has a shy nose, offering subtle whiffs of white stone fruit and spring wildflower while the simple palate offers orchard fruit, citrus zest and bitter almond flavors. It's fresh, with zesty acidity.

title: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Echo Indigo Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is simple, light and fruity wine. Blending two naturally herbal grapes, it is tangy, zesty and has light final acidity. Drink this lively wine now.

title: Vicentini Agostino 2015 Terre Lunghe  (Soave)
description: This simple, everyday white offers subdued aromas suggesting peach and citrus that carry over to the shy palate. Bright acidity lends a tangy finish.

title: Wilson 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Soft and lacking focus, this ripe and simple wine shows cherry, blackberry jam, chocolate and brown sugar flavors, the oak refreshingly subtle.

title: LangeTwins 2016 Estate Grown Rosé Sangiovese (Lodi)
description: Candied fruit aromas combine with fresh, jammy strawberry and cherry flavors for a light, almost sweet impression in this bright pink wine.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Pigmentum Malbec Rosé (Côtes du Lot)
description: This is a warm and ripe wine with a smooth caramel texture. That lies over the ripe red-berry fruits and balanced acidity. The result is a rounded wine that is ready to drink.

title: Lander-Jenkins 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Heavy butter, toast and caramel aromas and flavors give this wine a lot of impact, while the fruitiness is mild and the mouthfeel is soft.

title: Hillersden 2015 Legacy Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc Sparkling (Marlborough)
description: This tastes like Suavignon Blanc with bubbles, so I suppose it must be deemed successful. Tomato leaf, fig and citrus notes are elevated in intensity by the gentle presence of CO2, but finish short.

title: Hogue 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of apple and pear are followed by lightly concentrated fruit flavors. It's enjoyable but seems a bit faint.

title: Hogue 2015 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are barely a whisper, with notes of citrus and herb. It drinks dry with lightly concentrated fruit flavors. The variety seems hard to find.

title: Unparalleled 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Although only medium in body, this comes across as slightly heavy. Ripe flavors of nectarine, pineapple and mixed citrus are attractive, but lack refreshing zip on the finish.

title: Corte Adami 2016  Soave
description: This extremely simple but pleasantly fresh white offers green apple, peach and citrus hints. Zesty acidity gives it a lively character.

title: Domaine de Bendel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The wine is soft with a warm caramel and spice character. That contrasts easily with the red-currant fruits and lemon zest acidity. It is a clean fruity wine, ready to drink now.

title: Domaine de Millet 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a blend of the unusual Egiodola (a disease-resistant cross of native vines) and Syrah. This rosé version of two naturally tannic grapes turns out to be fruity and juicy. It is lively with crisp acidity and a lightly turned texture. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de Pellehaut 2016 Harmonie de Gascogne Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a caramel-flavored blend of Merlot, Tannat, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Malbec. That's a range, but the result is an attractive fruity and soft wine. It is bright at the end with plenty of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Château de Brigue 2016 Nautiqa Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This refreshing aromatic wine will appeal to the sailors with its nautical theme. It is light and fruity, just touched by spice and with lemon and red-currant fruitiness. The wine is lively and bright at the end.

title: Antica Hirpinia 2016  Greco di Tufo
description: This simple white offers exotic fruit aromas while the bright palate shows banana and pineapple notes. Zesty acidity gives it a refreshing finish.

title: Ascevi Luwa 2015 Grappoli Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. The lean, rather evolved palate still retains fresh acidity, but drink soon to capture the remaining yellow apple and lemon peel flavors.

title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Passeport Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a warm ripe wine. It has soft fruit with just the right amount of acidity to lift the strawberry fruits. It is in a fine apéritif style, very drinkable right now.

title: Bodegas Escudero 2015 Solar de Becquer  (Rioja)
description: Punchy raspberry and red-plum aromas are light and airy. That also describes the palate, which is dilute and lacks stuffing. Flavors of raspberry Kool-Aid and mild oak are fresh and floral on the finish. This may do best as a chilled simple sipper.

title: Pagani 2015  Soave Classico
description: This has subdued, somewhat funky leesy aromas that mingle with whiffs of pressed yellow flower, overripe citrus and dried thyme. The palate is oily and prematurely evolved, evoking mature yellow apple skin and toasted almond.

title: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Grillo (Sicilia)
description: This bright, informal white has light wildflower and tropical fruit scents. The uber simple, diluted palate offers citrus and peach flavors, alongside zesty acidity.

title: Le Battistelle 2014  Soave Classico
description: Toasted nut, graphite and medicinal herb scents lead the way in this wine. The lean, diluted palate evokes adhesive bandage, thyme and bitter almond, alongside brisk acidity.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Domaine San de Guilhem Carpe Guilhem Blanc Sec White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: From Bas Armagnac vineyards, this is a typical blend for Côtes de Gascogne. The wine's dollops of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc give a strongly herbal, fruity character. It is light and crisp, tangy in grapefruit and a powerful squeeze of lemon juice. Drink now.
designation: Domaine San de Guilhem Carpe Guilhem Blanc Sec

title: Dominio de Punctum 2016 Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Lemon-lime and bathroom cleanser aromas are tropical but a bit false. This feels medium to full but lacks character on the palate. Orange and persimmon flavors finish salty but not overly so.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: K5 Argiñano 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: By nature most Txakoli are lean and sharp. This one, with aromas of sea shells and yellow apple, is blaring with acid. That said, be prepared for tangy, fairly sour flavors of orange and lemon offset by a touch of spritz.

title: Merriam 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light pink and orange-copper colored, this wine is tart and diluted, showing restrained rose petal and cherry flavors.

title: Mascota 2015 ROD Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Rough conflicted aromas of horseradish, beets and horse hide lead to a hard grabby palate that feels sticky and tannic. The heavy oak blends with stewed herbal black-fruit flavors before a scratchy tannic finish.

title: Chakras 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Rubbery stewy berry aromas give way to a pinched-feeling palate. This tastes of salty roasted plum and it stays that way on a dense, chewy, meaty finish.
